intro: Psychotria tafaensis, commonly known as the Tafanis Psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in forests. Psychotria tafaensis is noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
